1:
Do not be irritated because of evildoers;\q do not be envious of those who act unrighteously.
\q
2:
For they will soon dry up as the grass\q and wither as the green plants.


\q
3:
Trust in Yahweh and do what is good;\q settle in the land and graze in faithfulness.
\q
4:
Then delight yourself in Yahweh,\q and he will give you the desires of your heart.


\q
5:
Give your ways to Yahweh;\q trust in him, and he will act on your behalf.
\q
6:
He will display your justice like the daylight\q and your innocence like the day at noon.


\q
7:
Be still before Yahweh and wait patiently for him.\q Do not be angry if someone succeeds in what he does,
\q or when he makes evil plots.



\q
8:
Do not be angry and frustrated.\q Do not worry. This only makes trouble.
\q
9:
Evildoers will be cut off,\q but those who wait for Yahweh will inherit the land.
\q
10:
In a little while the evil man will disappear;\q you will look at his place, but he will be gone.


\q
11:
But the meek will inherit the land\q and will delight in great prosperity.
\q
12:
The wicked man plots against the righteous\q and he grinds his teeth in rage against him.
\q
13:
The Lord laughs at him,\q for he sees that his day is coming.


\q
14:
The wicked have drawn out their swords and have bent their bows\q to cast down the oppressed and needy,
\q to kill those who are upright.
\q
15:
Their swords will pierce their own hearts,\q and their bows will be broken.


\q
16:
Better is the little that the righteous has\q than the abundance of many wicked people.
\q
17:
For the arms of the wicked people will be broken,\q but Yahweh supports the righteous people.


\q
18:
Yahweh watches over the blameless day by day,\q and their heritage will be forever.
\q
19:
They will not be ashamed when times are bad.\q When famine comes, they will have enough to eat.


\q
21:
The wicked person borrows but does not repay,\q but the righteous person is generous and gives.


\q
22:
Those who are blessed by God will inherit the land;\q those who are cursed by him will be cut off.
\q
23:
It is by Yahweh that a man's steps are established,\q the man whose way is commendable in God's sight.
\q
24:
Though he stumbles, he will not fall down,\q for Yahweh is holding him with his hand.


\q
25:
I was young and now am old;\q I have never seen the righteous person abandoned
\q or his children begging for bread.
\q
26:
All the day long he is gracious and lends,\q and his children become a blessing.
\q
27:
Turn away from evil and do what is right;\q then you will be safe forever.


\q
28:
For Yahweh loves justice\q and does not abandon his faithful followers.
\q They are preserved forever,
\q but the descendants of the wicked will be cut off.
\q
29:
The righteous will inherit the land\q and live there forever.
\q
30:
The mouth of the righteous person speaks wisdom\q and increases justice.


\q
31:
The law of his God is in his heart;\q his feet will not slip.
\q
32:
The wicked person watches the righteous person\q and seeks to kill him.
\q
33:
Yahweh will not abandon him into the evil person's hand\q or condemn him when he is judged.


\q
34:
Wait for Yahweh and keep his way,\q and he will raise you up to possess the land.
\q You will see when the wicked are cut off.


\q
35:
I have seen the wicked and terrifying person\q spread out like a green tree in its native soil.
\q
36:
But when I passed by again, he was not there.\q I looked for him, but he could not be found.


\q
37:
Observe the man of integrity, and mark the upright;\q there is a good future for a man of peace.
\q
38:
Sinners will be totally destroyed;\q the future for the wicked man is cut off.


\q
39:
Salvation of the righteous comes from Yahweh;\q he protects them in the times of trouble.
\q
40:
Yahweh helps them and rescues them.\q He rescues them from evil men and saves them
\q because they have taken refuge in him.
